Animated in both black-and-white and colour format

notes: The story was intended to be the Doctor's final battle with the Daleks, facilitating the transition of The Daleks into its own spin-off TV series.

Only episode two exists in the BBC Archives, but the story was released on DVD, Blu-Ray and Limited Edition Steelbook in 2021 with all seven episodes animated in both black-and-white and colour format.

real_world_cultural_references: J. Clark Maxwell's discoveries about electromagnetism

continuity_notes: The Doctor uses his knowledge of the cave systems of Skaro from his first adventure there.
Jamie wonders if the Chameleons could be behind the theft of the TARDIS.
The ultimate fate of the humanised Daleks and the end of the Dalek Civil War is revealed in 'Children of the Revolution'.

plot.plot_summary: The Second Doctor and Jamie discover that the TARDIS has been stolen. They are drawn into a trap set by the Daleks, who are experimenting with implanting the 'human factor' into Daleks in order to make them invincible. The Doctor agrees to assist, but secretly sabotages the experiment, leading to a Dalek civil war on Skaro.

The Doctor, Jamie and the newly-introduced companion Victoria Waterfield are taken to Skaro, the Dalek home planet, where the Daleks attempt to implant the Dalek Factor into humans. The Doctor subverts this plan, leading to a Dalek civil war that destroys the Dalek city.
